It does not work with Eclipse 3.1.1 as well.
Th problem is clear. Folder to be renamed was unsynchronized. Still think it is a bug to raise exception in this case

Alex, in this case was the folder synchronization expected? I.e., had you or some tool changed this folder from outside of Eclipse? I'm just trying to decide if this is an issue of inappropriate error reporting, or if there is a case where the workspace is becoming out of sync when it shouldn't be.  Also, what build of Eclipse 3.2 were you using when the error occurred?
Yes, this is just a case of inappropriate error reporting. I created an icon using external image editor and saved it to this directory but forgot to refresh it.

The exception is expected at the core level when the file is out of sync. However, I agree there seems to be a presentation problem when revealing this to the user.  When I try to rename a class, and make the file out of sync using an external ediro before finishing the refactoring, I get a dialog that says:

"An exception has been caught while processing the refactoring "Rename Foo.java to Bar.java"

Reason: Problems encountered while moving resources.

Details area is blank.

The CoreException thrown by IResource.move is a MultiStatus with text "Problems encountered while moving resources", and the child status says "Resource is out of sync with the file system: /Ja/src/p1/Foo.java".  It seems that the child of the multi-status should appear in the details area of the error dialog.

Fixed in HEAD.

The sync state is now checked upfront (as it is done with delete, move, etc.) and the user gets an error dialog if the resource is out of sync.

Also fixed bug 97764, such that we don't swallow the MultiStatus in other cases.
*** Bug 118782 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
